fundamentalRights.title: Right to Equality
fundamentalRights.summary: Everyone is equal before the law. No discrimination based on religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth.

details.title: Equality Before Law
details.explanation: The State shall not deny any person equality before the law or equal protection of laws within India. This means everyone, from the Prime Minister to a common citizen, is subject to the same laws.

details.title: Prohibition of Discrimination
details.explanation: No citizen can be discriminated against on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth. Special provisions can be made for women, children, and socially backward classes.

details.title: Equality in Public Employment
details.explanation: All citizens have equal opportunity in government jobs. Reservations can be made for backward classes not adequately represented in services.

details.title: Abolition of Untouchability
details.explanation: Untouchability is abolished and its practice in any form is forbidden. Enforcing any disability arising from untouchability is a punishable offense.

details.title: Abolition of Titles
details.explanation: No title (except military or academic) can be conferred by the State. No Indian citizen can accept titles from foreign states.

fundamentalRights.title: Right to Freedom
fundamentalRights.summary: Freedom of speech, movement, assembly, association, and profession. Protection against arbitrary arrest.

details.title: Six Freedoms
details.explanation: Citizens have freedom of speech and expression, peaceful assembly, forming associations, moving freely in India, residing anywhere, and practicing any profession. These come with reasonable restrictions.

details.title: Protection Against Conviction
details.explanation: No one can be punished for an act that wasn't illegal when committed. No one can be tried twice for the same offense. No one can be forced to be a witness against themselves.

details.title: Right to Life and Liberty
details.explanation: No person can be deprived of life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law. This has been expanded to include right to live with dignity, privacy, and clean environment.

details.title: Protection Against Arrest
details.explanation: Every arrested person must be told why they're arrested, allowed to consult a lawyer, and produced before a magistrate within 24 hours.

fundamentalRights.title: Right Against Exploitation
fundamentalRights.summary: Prohibition of human trafficking, forced labor, and child labor in hazardous industries.

details.title: Prohibition of Human Trafficking
details.explanation: Traffic in human beings and begar (forced labor without payment) is prohibited. Any violation is punishable by law. This protects against modern forms of slavery and bonded labor.

details.title: Child Labor Prohibition
details.explanation: No child below 14 years can be employed in any factory, mine, or hazardous employment. This protects children's right to education and healthy development.

fundamentalRights.title: Freedom of Religion
fundamentalRights.summary: Freedom to practice, profess, and propagate any religion. India is a secular nation.

details.title: Freedom of Conscience
details.explanation: All persons have the right to freely profess, practice, and propagate religion, subject to public order, morality, and health.

details.title: Religious Affairs Management
details.explanation: Every religious denomination can establish and maintain institutions, manage religious affairs, own property, and administer it according to law.

details.title: No Religious Tax
details.explanation: No person can be compelled to pay taxes for promoting any particular religion.

details.title: Religious Instruction in Schools
details.explanation: No religious instruction in fully state-funded schools. Others can provide it, but no one can be forced to attend such instruction.

fundamentalRights.title: Cultural & Educational Rights
fundamentalRights.summary: Protection of minorities' culture, language, and right to establish educational institutions.

details.title: Protection of Interests of Minorities
details.explanation: Any section of citizens with distinct language, script, or culture has the right to conserve it. No citizen can be denied admission to educational institutions on grounds of religion, race, caste, or language.

details.title: Minorities' Educational Rights
details.explanation: All minorities (religious and linguistic) have the right to establish and administer educational institutions of their choice. The State cannot discriminate against them in granting aid.

fundamentalRights.title: Right to Constitutional Remedies
fundamentalRights.summary: The right to approach Supreme Court if fundamental rights are violated. The soul of the Constitution.

details.title: Right to Move Supreme Court
details.explanation: Citizens can directly approach the Supreme Court if their fundamental rights are violated. The Court can issue writs like Habeas Corpus, Mandamus, Prohibition, Certiorari, and Quo Warranto. Dr. Ambedkar called this the 'heart and soul' of the Constitution.

fundamentalDuties.title: Respect the Constitution
fundamentalDuties.description: To abide by the Constitution and respect its ideals, institutions, the National Flag, and the National Anthem.

fundamentalDuties.title: Cherish Freedom Struggle
fundamentalDuties.description: To cherish and follow the noble ideals that inspired the national struggle for freedom.

fundamentalDuties.title: Uphold Unity
fundamentalDuties.description: To uphold and protect the sovereignty, unity, and integrity of India.

fundamentalDuties.title: Defend the Country
fundamentalDuties.description: To defend the country and render national service when called upon to do so.

fundamentalDuties.title: Promote Harmony
fundamentalDuties.description: To promote harmony and brotherhood among all people of India, transcending religious, linguistic, and regional diversities.

fundamentalDuties.title: Preserve Heritage
fundamentalDuties.description: To value and preserve the rich heritage of our composite culture.

fundamentalDuties.title: Protect Environment
fundamentalDuties.description: To protect and improve the natural environment including forests, lakes, rivers, and wildlife.

fundamentalDuties.title: Scientific Temper
fundamentalDuties.description: To develop scientific temper, humanism, and the spirit of inquiry and reform.

fundamentalDuties.title: Safeguard Public Property
fundamentalDuties.description: To safeguard public property and to abjure violence.

fundamentalDuties.title: Strive for Excellence
fundamentalDuties.description: To strive towards excellence in all spheres of individual and collective activity.

fundamentalDuties.title: Provide Education
fundamentalDuties.description: To provide opportunities for education to children between 6-14 years (added by 86th Amendment).
